workflow.name: Automate email bounce & invalid detection with Gmail, Google Sheets & Slack
workflow.description:
## Description
This workflow automatically detects bounced or invalid email addresses from your Gmail inbox and updates their status in Google Sheets. It fetches bounce notifications, extracts failed email addresses, and matches them against your contact list to update each record‚Äôs status as ‚ÄúNot Found‚Äù (bounced) or ‚ÄúNot Sent‚Äù (no bounce). Additionally, it runs a daily scheduled summary that sends bounce statistics to Slack, helping marketing or sales teams maintain clean, up-to-date mailing lists.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
- üì¨ Fetch Bounce Notifications from Gmail
-  Retrieves bounce messages automatically filtered by sender mailer-daemon@googlemail.com.
- üî¢ Get Latest 5 Bounces
-  Sorts all bounce emails by date and limits processing to the five most recent to keep performance fast and focused.
- üîç Parse Bounced Email Addresses
-  Extracts failed email addresses from Gmail message snippets using regex pattern matching.
- üìã Fetch All Email Contacts from Google Sheets
-  Loads all contact records from your ‚ÄúFraud Email‚Äù sheet, including columns like Name, Email, Status, and Last Updated.
- üîó Combine Bounce Data with Contact List
-  Merges parsed bounce results with your existing contact data to prepare for status updates.
- ‚úÖ Match & Update Contact Status
  - Marks ‚ÄúNot Found‚Äù for bounced emails.
  - Marks ‚ÄúNot Sent‚Äù for valid but inactive ones.
  - Updates ‚ÄúLast Updated‚Äù timestamp for all.
- üíæ Write Updated Status Back to Sheet
-  Pushes updated contact information (Status and Last Updated) back into Google Sheets, ensuring centralized record accuracy.
- ‚è∞ Daily 7PM Trigger
-  Automatically starts the summary workflow every evening at 7:00 PM.
- üßÆ Calculate Summary Statistics
-  Counts total invalid emails (‚ÄúNot Found‚Äù) and inactive ones (‚ÄúNot Sent‚Äù).
  - üí¨ Send Slack Daily Summary
  -  Sends a formatted report to your #email-cleanup Slack channel showing:
  - üìß Invalid email count
  - üì≠ No activity count
  - ‚úÖ Reminder to maintain list hygiene

## Prerequisites
- Gmail account connected with n8n
- Google Sheet (Fraud Email) with contact data
- Slack workspace and channel for daily reports
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)

## Step-by-Step Setup
- Connect Gmail ‚Üí Fetch bounce notifications.
- Add Google Sheet ‚Üí Load and update contact data.
- Parse bounces ‚Üí Identify failed email addresses.
- Merge & update ‚Üí Sync statuses in Google Sheet.
- Enable daily trigger ‚Üí Schedule Slack summaries.

## Customization Ideas
üéØ Expand bounce limit beyond 5 recent messages.
 üì¢ Add a Gmail label like ‚ÄúBounced‚Äù after processing.
 üìö Integrate with HubSpot or Airtable for CRM sync.
 üí° Include timestamps or sender domains in Slack summary.

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Keeps mailing lists accurate and deliverable
 ‚úÖ Saves hours of manual bounce management
 ‚úÖ Automates email hygiene with zero supervision
 ‚úÖ Provides transparent daily Slack reports
 ‚úÖ 100% automated, efficient, and scalable

## Perfect For
üë• Marketing and outreach teams managing bulk campaigns
 üè¢ Businesses maintaining verified contact databases
 üìä Sales teams using Gmail and Google Sheets
 ‚öôÔ∏è Agencies ensuring top-tier email deliverability

parameters.content:
## üéØ MAIN WORKFLOW - Email Bounce Detection

**Purpose:** Detects bounced emails from Gmail and updates Google Sheets

**Flow:**
1. Manually trigger or schedule to run
2. Fetch bounce notifications from Gmail (mailer-daemon)
3. Get latest 5 bounces to process
4. Parse email addresses from bounce messages
5. Fetch all contacts from Google Sheet
6. Merge bounce data with contact list
7. Match emails and update status ("Not Found" if bounced)
8. Write updated status back to sheet

**Sheet Columns Updated:**
- Status: "Not Found" (bounced) or "Not Sent" (no bounce)
- Last Updated: Current timestamp

## üìä DAILY REPORTING WORKFLOW

**Purpose:** Sends daily summary to Slack at 7 PM

**Flow:**
1. Cron trigger fires daily at 19:00 (7 PM)
2. Read all data from Google Sheet
3. Calculate statistics:
   - Count "Not Found" status (invalid emails)
   - Count "Not Sent" status (no activity)
4. Format and send summary to Slack channel

**Slack Channel:** #email-cleanup

## üöÄ START HERE

**Two Ways to Run:**

1. **Manual:** Click "Execute workflow" button for testing

2. **Automatic:** Set up a schedule trigger (replace manual trigger)

**Note:** This triggers the main bounce detection workflow

## üì¨ FETCH BOUNCES

**What it does:**
Retrieves ALL bounce notification emails from Gmail

**Filter:**
- Sender: mailer-daemon@googlemail.com

**Output:**
List of bounce emails with snippets containing failed addresses

## üî¢ LIMIT PROCESSING

**What it does:**
Sorts bounces by date and keeps only the 5 newest

**Why:**
- Prevents overwhelming the workflow
- Focuses on recent bounces
- Improves performance

**Sorting:** Newest first (descending by internalDate)

## üîç EXTRACT EMAILS

**What it does:**
Parses bounce message snippets to extract failed email addresses

**Regex Pattern:**
`wasn't delivered to [email]`

**Output Fields:**
- failedEmail
- subject
- id
- snippet

## üìã GET CONTACTS

**What it does:**
Reads ALL rows from Google Sheet

**Sheet:** Fraud Email
**Tab:** Sheet1

**Expected Columns:**
- Name
- Email
- Status
- Last Updated

**Note:** Runs in parallel with bounce fetch

## üîó MERGE DATA

**What it does:**
Combines two data streams:
1. Bounced email addresses
2. All contacts from sheet

**Result:**
Single data stream containing both bounce info and contact list for comparison

## ‚úÖ UPDATE STATUS

**What it does:**
Matches emails and sets status:

- **"Not Found"** if email appears in bounce list
- **"Not Sent"** if email NOT in bounce list

**Also Updates:**
- Last Updated: Current timestamp

**Output:** Prepared data for sheet update

## üíæ SAVE TO SHEET

**What it does:**
Writes updated status back to Google Sheet

**Update Method:**
- Match on: Name column
- Update: Status & Last Updated columns

**Result:**
Sheet now reflects which emails bounced

## ‚è∞ DAILY SCHEDULE

**What it does:**
Automatically triggers daily report

**Schedule:**
Every day at 19:00 (7 PM)

**Triggers:** Daily summary workflow to send Slack notification

## üìñ READ SHEET

**What it does:**
Fetches current data from sheet for reporting

**Reads:**
All rows with current status values

**Purpose:**
Provide data for statistics calculation

## üßÆ CALCULATE STATS

**What it does:**
Counts contacts by status:

- **Invalid emails:** Count of "Not Found" status
- **No activity:** Count of "Not Sent" status

**Output:**
Single item with formatted statistics

## üí¨ SEND TO SLACK

**What it does:**
Posts formatted summary to Slack

**Channel:** #email-cleanup

**Message Includes:**
- üìß Invalid email count
- üì≠ No activity count
- Timestamp of report

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)
